Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Analysis: AI proposed a broad expansion of 'Permitted Recipients' to include advisors, financiers, and shareholders. HR implemented a partial expansion, adding directors, shareholders, and potential syndicate members, addressing the core of the AI's concern.
AI proposed adding exceptions for automated backups and internal work product. HR implemented this change almost verbatim, bringing the clause into full compliance.
AI proposed removing the restriction that prevented the general solicitation carve-out from applying to managers. HR implemented this correction, fully addressing the AI's point.
AI proposed deleting the clause that prohibited acting as part of a syndicate or consortium. HR deleted the clause in its entirety as recommended.
AI proposed adding an exception for contact made in the ordinary course of business. HR added this exact exception, resolving the issue as suggested.
AI proposed deleting the clause granting rights to non-signatory third parties. HR deleted the entire clause, fully adopting the AI's recommendation.
AI proposed changing the one-sided assignment clause to be mutual. HR replaced the original text with a mutual right of assignment, aligning with the AI's suggestion.
AI proposed changing the governing law and jurisdiction from Netherlands/Amsterdam to the playbook-preferred Belgium/Antwerp. HR implemented this change exactly as suggested.

Issues Missed by the AI.Analysis: AI did not mention this. HR added a bespoke exception to limit liability for breaches of the non-solicitation (clause 11) and no-contact (clause 12) obligations by Permitted Recipients.

Issues Missed by the AI.Issue: Best Efforts Standard in Compelled Disclosure
Issues Missed by the AI.Analysis: AI did not mention this. HR added a 'best efforts' standard to the obligation to procure a protective order in Section 8, an application of Policy 13 that the AI did not flag.

Issues Flagged by AI but Not Addressed b.Analysis: AI flagged a clause prohibiting consortium arrangements and recommended its deletion. This clause remains unaddressed in the HR edits.

AI proposed changing the strict liability standard for Permitted Recipient breaches to 'best efforts'. HR did not implement this change, leaving the strict liability standard in place for this clause.
AI flagged that the definition of 'Information' was missing a standard exception for information received from a third party without a duty of confidentiality. This exception was not added by HR.

High Priority.citation: Information may be made available to employees within your organisation (including employees of subsidiaries and affiliates) and to external consultants who are directly involved in the Proposed Transaction... (such persons each a 'Permitted Recipient')
High Priority.problem: The definition of 'Permitted Recipient' is too narrow. It must be expanded to include shareholders, potential syndicate members, and other providers of finance to allow for standard deal syndication and financing activities.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Information may be disclosed by you to your affiliates and your and their respective directors, officers, employees, consultants, advisers, shareholders, potential syndicate members, agents, representatives, and other providers of financing (collectively, 'Permitted Recipients'), who need to know such information for the Proposed Transaction, provided that you shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by your Permitted Recipients.

High Priority.citation: All Information provided to you... will be returned, destroyed and/or permanently removed... The obligation to return or destroy Information shall not apply to the retention of Information, which is required by any applicable law or regulation...
High Priority.problem: The return and destruction clause is too absolute. It fails to include mandatory exceptions for information retained on automated backup systems and within internal work product (Secondary Information), which are operationally impractical to destroy.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Upon a Provider's written request, you shall return or destroy all Information. However, this obligation shall not apply to: (i) Information that you or your Permitted Recipients must retain under any applicable law, rule or regulation; (ii) Information and elaborations thereof as have been saved to electronic carriers under automatic archiving or data security procedures; and (iii) reports, notes or other materials prepared by or on behalf of you which incorporate Information ('Secondary Information'). Any Information or Secondary Information that is not returned or destroyed shall remain subject to the confidentiality terms of this Agreement.

High Priority.citation: Except for those in a managerial or key position within the Group, these restrictions will not apply to contact an employee or independent service provider: (i) whom responds to any general solicitation for employment...
High Priority.problem: The non-solicitation clause is non-compliant because the exemption for hiring individuals who respond to general advertisements does not apply to managerial staff. This exemption must apply to all employees without exception.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: For a period of two (2) years from the date of this Agreement, you agree not to directly solicit for employment any employee of a Provider with whom you had material contact in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not apply to any of your affiliated portfolio companies, nor shall it apply to employees who respond to general public advertisements, make an unsolicited application for employment, are referred by a third-party recruiter who was not instructed to target a Provider's employees, or whose employment was terminated by the Provider.

High Priority.citation: ...enter into or maintain any arrangement with any potential acquirer... in relation to making a joint proposal (or forming any kind of consortium or other co-operation arrangement), either directly or indirectly...
High Priority.problem: This clause explicitly prohibits forming a consortium to make a joint proposal. Per playbook policy, any clause prohibiting consortiums is unacceptable and must be removed to allow for potential syndication.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause must be deleted in its entirety.

High Priority.citation: You acknowledge and confirm that you are acting on your own behalf and not as agent, nominee, trustee, broker or as part of a syndicate or consortium...
High Priority.problem: This clause forces the recipient to act alone and not as part of a syndicate or consortium. This is a prohibited restriction and must be removed.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause must be deleted in its entirety.

Medium Priority.citation: ...contact any current or former directors, officers, employees, agents, advisers or other representatives of the Group or the Sellers nor any customers, distributors, suppliers, clients, lenders, shareholders or other counterparts of the Group...
Medium Priority.problem: The no-contact clause is overly broad. It restricts contact with a wide range of stakeholders (customers, suppliers, etc.) without providing a necessary exception for contact made in the ordinary course of business or for pre-existing relationships.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Without the prior written consent of the Providers, you agree not to contact any directors, officers, or employees of the Providers in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not be breached by any contact made in the ordinary course of business unrelated to the Proposed Transaction. Any restriction on contacting customers, suppliers, or other stakeholders must permit contacts that were already established in the ordinary course of business.

Medium Priority.citation: The undertakings given by you under this confidentiality agreement are given to the Company but are also for the benefit of each other Provider, as an irrevocable third-party stipulation for no consideration...
Medium Priority.problem: This clause grants enforceable rights to 'each other Provider', which is a broad group of non-signatory third parties. The agreement must not grant enforceable rights to any entity that is not a party to the contract.

Medium Priority.citation: You shall not directly or indirectly assign or transfer... without the prior written consent of the Company. The Company is entitled to assign or transfer... to any of its affiliates or third parties...
Medium Priority.problem: The assignment clause is a one-sided restriction, prohibiting the recipient from assigning its rights while allowing the counterparty to do so. The agreement must either be silent or provide a mutual right of assignment to affiliates.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Each party may assign or transfer its rights and obligations under this Agreement to any of its affiliates without the prior written consent of the other party.

Low Priority.citation: You remain fully responsible and accountable for the compliance of the Permitted Recipients with the provisions of this confidentiality agreement.
Low Priority.problem: This clause imposes strict liability for breaches by Representatives. The preferred position is to limit this liability to an 'efforts-based' standard.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: You will use your best efforts to procure that each of your Permitted Recipients who receives any Information is aware of and adheres to the terms of this Agreement. You shall be responsible for any breach of the confidentiality obligations of this Agreement by your Permitted Recipients.

Low Priority.citation: ...information which at the time of supply is in or comes into the public domain... is already in or comes into your lawful possession... and/or which is independently developed in good faith by you...
Low Priority.problem: The exceptions to the definition of 'Information' are incomplete. It is missing the standard market exception for information received from a third party that is not under a confidentiality obligation to the disclosing party.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no breach by you of the confidentiality undertakings hereunder; (b) was in your lawful possession before receipt from a Provider, without any obligation of confidentiality owed to the Provider; (c) was received in good faith by you from a third party that is not subject to an obligation of confidentiality owed to a Provider; or (d) was disclosed by you pursuant to the written permission of a duly authorized representative of a Provider.

Low Priority.citation: ...shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Netherlands. Any disputes... shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the District Court in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
Low Priority.problem: The agreement uses Dutch law and Amsterdam courts. While this is an acceptable European fallback, it deviates from the playbook's stated preference for Belgian law and the exclusive courts of Antwerp, Belgium.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: This Agreement, and any contractual or non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Belgium. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts in Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 2
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'Information may be made available to ++[directors and]{.mark}++ employees... (including ++[directors and]{.mark}++ employees of subsidiaries and affiliates) and to ++[shareholders, potential syndicate members or]{.mark}++ external consultants...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The definition of 'Permitted Recipient' was expanded to include 'directors', 'shareholders', and 'potential syndicate members'. This is a positive change that brings the clause into alignment with High Priority Policy 2, which requires a broad definition of who can receive confidential information.

hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...You remain fully responsible and accountable for the compliance of the Permitted Recipients with the provisions of this confidentiality agreement, ++ [except for clause 11 and 12]{.mark}++.'
hr_edits_data.problem: An exception was added to Strada's liability for its Representatives' compliance, specifically for the non-solicitation (clause 11) and no-contact (clause 12) obligations. This change is not explicitly covered by any playbook policy and represents a bespoke legal modification to limit Strada's liability.

hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...and you will, and ++[use best efforts to]{.mark} ++procure that the Permitted Recipients will, (i) use best efforts to obtain a protective order...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The phrase 'use best efforts to' was added, changing the standard of liability for procuring Representatives' compliance from strict to efforts-based. This aligns with the preference stated in Low Priority Policy 13.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 3
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'The obligation to return or destroy Information shall not apply to [++(i) Information...saved to electronic carriers under automatic archiving..., (ii) reports, notes or other materials...('Secondary Information'), (iii)]{.mark} ++ the retention of Information, which is required by any applicable law...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The clause was modified to add standard exceptions to the obligation to destroy information, specifically for automated backups and internal work product ('Secondary Information'). This corrects a major omission and brings the clause into compliance with High Priority Policy 3.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 4
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '...for a period of --two-- year...approach any employee...--or within one of its associated companies--...--Except for those in a managerial or key position within the Group, --These restrictions will not apply...' New: '...for a period of ++[one]++ year...approach any employee...[removes restriction on affiliates]...[removes exception for management]...These restrictions will not apply...'
hr_edits_data.problem: Multiple changes were made to the employee non-solicitation clause. The term was reduced to one year, the restriction on Strada's affiliates was removed, and the carve-out for general solicitations was correctly applied to all employees. These changes fix several violations and bring the clause into compliance with High Priority Policy 4.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 6
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...contact any...customers, distributors, suppliers...in connection with the Proposed Transaction... ++ You shall not be deemed to have breached this obligation in the event of contact in the ordinary course of business, for other purposes than in connection with the Proposed Transaction. ++'
hr_edits_data.problem: The original 'no-contact' clause was overly broad. An exception was added to permit contact made in the 'ordinary course of business' for purposes unrelated to the transaction. This addition satisfies a key requirement of Medium Priority Policy 6.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 7
hr_edits_data.citation: Deleted: '--The undertakings given by you under this confidentiality agreement are given to the Company but are also for the benefit of each other Provider, as an irrevocable third-party stipulation for no consideration...--'
hr_edits_data.problem: A clause granting enforceable rights to non-signatory 'Providers' as third-party beneficiaries was deleted. This removal brings the agreement into compliance with Medium Priority Policy 7.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 2
hr_edits_data.citation: Deleted: '--You acknowledge and confirm that you are acting on your own behalf and not as agent...or as part of a syndicate or consortium and that you envisage to consummate the Proposed Transaction yourself in its entirety.--'
hr_edits_data.problem: A clause that prohibited Strada from acting as part of a syndicate or consortium was deleted. This removal is required by High Priority Policy 2, which mandates that Strada must not be prohibited from forming consortiums.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 9
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '--You shall not directly or indirectly assign or transfer...without the prior written consent of the Company--.' New: '++You and ++the Company are entitled to assign or transfer...this confidentiality agreement to any of its affiliates or third parties from time to time.'
hr_edits_data.problem: A one-sided restriction on assignment that prevented Strada from assigning its rights was replaced with a mutual right for either party to assign the agreement. This corrects a violation of Medium Priority Policy 9.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 11
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '...governed by...the laws of --the Netherlands--...jurisdiction of the...District Court in --Amsterdam--' New: '...governed by...the laws of ++Belgium++...jurisdiction of the ++courts++ in ++Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium++'
hr_edits_data.problem: The governing law and jurisdiction were changed from the Netherlands/Amsterdam to Belgium/Antwerp. This change brings the clause into full compliance with Strada's preferred position as stated in Low Priority Policy 11.
